oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Purchase of an "Apparatus"
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside advertising a Lecture on "The Present Physical Condition of the Internal Parts of the Earth" and a recitation of "Collins' Ode on the Passions," for the puropse of raising funds for the purchase of an "apparatus" by the friends of Fayette Academy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Eduaction; Music; Poetry; Collins, William, 1721-1759
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The "Fayettville Observer" like many newspaper publishers, published broadsides to supplement their income and keep the presses busy between newspaper printings.
